Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm an early bird, and I'm a night owl. So I'm wise, and I have worms. Oh, breakfast.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I got your sausage, egg and cheese biscuit.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yummy, yummy. Thank you, Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What was the thing, ah, you needed me to come in early for?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um. The sausage, egg, and cheese biscuit. But thank you. And why don't you take a couple hours. The office is yours. "Home Alone," "Risky Business." Take your pants off, run around. Whatever you gotta do.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm just going to take a nap in my car until work starts.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. [Removes biscuit, leaving only sausage, egg and cheese.] Healthier. Gotta watch those carbs.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Today, I, Michael Scott, am becoming a homeowner. Investing in real estate.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Diversifying. Smart.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes it is. Yes it is. It is very important to own property. Back in olden days, they would not even let you vote unless you owned property and they'd throw you in the stocks and humiliate you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And it worked. They should bring the stocks back. People'd obey the law, there'd be less troublemakers.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [looks bored. Taps finger on desk. Head falls to desk]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Every so often, Jim dies of boredom. I think today it was the expense reports that did him in. And our deal is that, it's up to me to revive him.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You see Dwight's coffee mug?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sometimes when he's not here, I try to throw stuff in it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No way. Let's do this [crumples post it and throws into mug. Misses.] Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wind.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Try paperclips. Oh wait. This message. For Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Perfect. [misses]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You should go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. Yes. Final walkthrough.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh huh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sign the papers at the condo.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You have your lawyer there?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, I don't need one.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Can I be your representative?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't need a representative.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I think I should be there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm good. I can make sure things are up to code.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. Dwight. I'm fine.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Please, I'm always the guy you rely on at work.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, this isn't about work. This is closing on a condo, it's completely personal.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So you're taking a personal day?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Except that, this is about my living arrangement, and as boss, I need to have a living arrangement in order to do work.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Please, I'll make you proud.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. Fine. Yes, you can come.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes! As your representative?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: As my associate.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Same thing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No it is not.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I have been Michael's #2 guy for about 5 years. And we make a great team. We're like one of those classic famous teams. He's like Mozart, and I'm like Mozart's friend. No. I'm like Butch Cassidy, and Michael is like Mozart. You try and hurt Mozart; you're going to get a bullet in your head courtesy of Butch Cassidy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, most honorable Pamera. Not offensive, because that's the way they talk in movies.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You headed out?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We are. Dwight and I are going to the big thing. So why don't you have everybody work on their expense reports and I'd like them in by the end of the day.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Very good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Have a great time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We will. Um, did you do the thing I asked you to do about the magazines?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I changed them to your new address.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good. The Small Business Man?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maxim? American Way? Cracked?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, I changed your Cracked magazine subscription.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How about, uh, Fine Arts? Aficionado Monthly?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [shakes head]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: NO, well can you get on that, because I don't just read Cracked. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. See you soon.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What kind of shocks you got on this baby?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know, regular. Normal ones. Nothing fancy. Not my style. What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [tries to open sun roof] I want to put the top down.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What? No, Dwight. It's fifty degrees outside. Don't... please...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But then no one can see us.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I... Just... Would you put it up? [roof opens] Ok. Fine. Just leave it down. Whiner.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Check it out. [points at sunglasses] Terminator.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I do not understand what you spend your money on.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [paper football lands on desk] Ooh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Oscar, on these new expense reports, do we really have to go back to last quarter?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah. It's a terrible system, I know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [points at paper on desk] What does 2005 season mean?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Eh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait a minute, what is this?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's a scoreboard.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Kevin and I play this paper football game when Michael's out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Or when we're bored.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh my God! Wait, this goes back two years.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: We're bored a lot.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [flicks football onto Kevin's desk] OH!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Sweet!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes! So close. I really love the paper triangle flicking and hitting things game. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: We call it Hate Ball.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Because of how much Angela hates it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, do you guys have any other games?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Sometimes we play "Who can put the most M&M's in their mouth?"

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You play that.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You should ask Toby to teach you Dunderball.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Home, sweet home.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Which one's yours?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right there. My sanctuary. My party pad. Someday I can just see my grandkids learning how to walk out here. Hang a swing from this tree. Push them back... wait... [turns around] no, it's this one, right here. Home, sweet home.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [bounces ball off wall with Toby] So that's what this sound is all day.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Michael, this is Bill. He's the head of the condo association.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, how are you? Nice to meet you, Bill. Bill. Mr. Bill. OHHH NOOO. MR. BILL. OHHH! SNL? When they pull him apart? He'd always get rolled over by something.

Quote.Speaker: Bill
Quote.Text: Nice to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nice to meet you too.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is smaller than your old place.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, small. I'm buying it and I'm not renting it. So, it's still an upgrade. He doesn't know anything about property ownership. Kind of an idiot. Um.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Actually, I do own property. My grandfather left me a 60 acre working beet farm. I run it with my cousin, Mose. We sell beets to local stores and restaurants. It's a nice little farm. Sometimes teenagers use it for sex.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Are we ready to sign some papers?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Actually, no. We have a couple of questions, about the neighborhood.

Quote.Speaker: Bill
Quote.Text: It's very safe. It's very clean. Also, it's very accepting of all lifestyles.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: It's a very gay-friendly neighborhood.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. Good. That's good. It's good to be accommodating of that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's go check out the master bedroom.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Stanley. Just played Dunder Ball with Toby. What about you, you got any games?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Yeah, I got a game. It's called "work hard so my kids can go to college."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Fair enough.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This, my friends, is the master bedroom. Check out the cathedral ceilings. Those are like seventeen feet high. We have cable readiness. [points at wall] Right there. I am going to totally pimp this place out. I am going to put a surround sound system. I am going to put a plasma screen right against this wall.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh. Terrible idea.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm putting my bed right over here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no, no. This is a shared wall. Neighbor throws his wife into the wall, plasma screen hits the floor. Totally smashed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, then I will get a warrantee.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Warrantees don't cover it, plus they're a rip-off.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well then I won't get a warrantee.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Shh Shh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So that's the problem, is solved. What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Listen. [puts ear to wall] Can you hear that? Oh man. These babies are thin.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [sings Olympic theme song] This scented candle ...andle ...andle. Which I found in the men's bathroom ...room ...room. Represents the eternal burning of competition. Or something.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: It smells like cookies.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes it does. Yes it does my friend. Ok, we will be competing for gold, silver and bronze yogurt lids.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Now the bronze are really blue, and they're also the back side of the gold, so no flipping. K? Honor system.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I do play games. I sing and I dangle things in front of my cats. I play lots of games. Just not at work.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Let the games begin. [sings Olympic theme]

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: And then, I just need you to sign here at this arrow.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What kind of mortgage did you get?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh... Ten year.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Well, ten over thirty, so thirty year total.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What? Wha? You said ten.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Ten year fixed, over thirty. Thirty year total.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ho, thirty years.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, ok, ok.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wow, you'll be paying this off in your mid-seventies.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Forget about retiring when you're 65. Hey, I've got an idea. You know that extra bedroom? If the whole girlfriend thing never happens, that's where the nurse can live.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. Alright. Oh boy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, this is it.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Whenever you're ready.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um. Oh. [moves stove burner] Oh, ok. Is that suppose to come off?

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Actually yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, look! Cool. Carpenter ants.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um. I'm going to take a little breather for a second. Excuse me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We'll be here waiting for you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, man.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: A thirty year mortgage at Michael's age essentially means that he's buying a coffin. If I were buying my coffin, I would get one with thicker walls so you couldn't hear the other dead people.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Whenever you're ready, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh. [breathes deeply, head at knees]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You have what is the national sport of Icelandic paper companies. And I'm blanking on the name, can you help me out Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim, they refer to it as Flonkerton.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hum.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: In English, box of paper snowshoe racing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Fair enough, but I like Flonkerton.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: The thing about Jim, is when he's excited about something, like the Office Olympics, he gets really into it and he does a really great job. But the problem with Jim is that he works here, so that hardly ever happens.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, who will be challenging Kevin in Flonkerton? Anyone?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'll do it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes! Phyllis! [claps] Phyllis, just put your foot right through here [lifts strap on box of paper]. Right through the flonk.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The ceilings are lower than they were last week. That, I don't... I don't...

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...know if you showed me this same unit or not.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Michael, this is the unit you saw and...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Where are all the hot people? I was told that there would be all these attractive singles.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Who told you that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: As far as I can tell, I'm the best-looking person here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There's a basic principle in real estate, that you should never be the best-looking person in the development. It's just sorta common sense, because if you are, then you've no place to go but down.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Is this a financial thing? If it's a financial thing, what some people do is they rent out the third bedroom.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: That's some extra income for you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am not going to rent the third bedroom. I want a price reduction or I am a-walkin.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: You will lose $7,000 if you walk away right now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ehhhh....

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I made the right decision. I'm glad I signed. I'm a homeowner. Right? Good to be a homeowner. Diversifying. This is good. This is fun. We're having fun.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Totally having fun. Can you imagine those poor saps stuck at the office today? [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Here we go. Here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Go! Go! Go!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Pair of shoes!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dig deep, dig deep! OHHHhhh! It's Phyllis!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's Phyllis!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Phyllis by a nose. Gold medal in Flernenton.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Flonkerton.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you, delegate from Iceland.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Wow!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [empties bowl of M&M's into his mouth]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow! Ok. No one else should even try! Gold medals! Give him medals. Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There's something else Dwight wanted to talk to you about. I have a surprise for you, for helping me out today.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You didn't have to...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no. I insist. I insist. Because you've really done some great work. Great work. And that is why, I am going to let you move into my third bedroom and pay me rent.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why did I do it? Because I believe in rewarding people for their efforts. Ah. I rewarded Dwight with the room, and he is rewarding me back, ah, with $500 plus utilities.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't even know what to say.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm thinking, lock into a four year commitment, we'll go month to month after that. Or, until I start dating, have a girlfriend, then you're, you know, you're gone.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Question. Where can I put my terrarium?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What the hell is a terrarium?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's a fish tank for snakes and lizards.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, so an aquarium. Ah, that will not come into this place.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Question. My grandparents left me a large number of armoires.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Are you sure you don't want to play?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'm sure.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Come on Angela, don't you have a game?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I have one, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, let's play, what is it?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I call it Pam Pong. I count how many times Jim gets up from his desk and goes to reception to talk to you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We're friends.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Apparently.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Very nicely done. I think that's H-O-R for Stanley, and H-O for Phyllis.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Are you calling me a ho?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh my god. Phyllis, coming alive. I like it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Question. What about carpooling, who pays for the gas?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We take separate cars.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Question. Can sometimes I drive your car and you drive mine?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why would we do that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just for fun?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Question. Who is the primary on the fire insurance?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: EHHHHNT. Game over. Offer revoked. Dwight. I'm sorry, but you reach out and you try to be a nice guy, and help out a friend, and this is what happens. This is what I get. Oh god. I'm ... Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank god. It was nice of him to offer, but I live in a nine bedroom farm house. I have my own crossbow range. It's a perfect situation for me. Although two bathrooms would have been nice, we just have the one. And it's under the porch.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Ah...

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: OH!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Who had someone from Vance Refrigeration?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I did.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ryan Howard. Ryan! [claps] Gold medal.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I made something for our closing ceremonies.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What? [looks in box] Oh my god. Where did you have time to make that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Automatic voicemail.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright Pam, alright [gives her hi-five]. Nice work!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [sees Angela making check mark on tally sheet]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: A little bit more and I would have had it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know you can always refinance your mortgage. We had a 15 year on our beet farm. We paid it off early.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, you know what? Nobody cares about your stupid beet farm. Beets are the worst.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: People love beets.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nobody likes beets.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Everybody loves beets.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nobody likes beets, Dwight. Why don't you grow something that everybody does like? You should grow candy. I'd love a piece of candy right now. Not a beet.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's get this roof going.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stop it! [smacks Dwight's arm]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ow.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Final lap. Final lap. Time to beat is 1:15.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Oscar!

Quote.Speaker: Crowd
Quote.Text: Go! Go! Go!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Time to beat is one minute, 15 seconds. Here they come. [Michael and Dwight enter] Guys?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What is going on?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nothing. Guys? Timer's still going? Er?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's my stopwatch.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [hands expense report to Oscar] Here you go. All done.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I filled out the expense reports. That took about five minutes and then I closed two sales at lunch time. So, about as productive as any other day. If not more so.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I figured I could throw it away now, or I could keep it for a couple of months and then throw it away. I mean, it was really nice of Pam to make them, but what am I going to do with a gold medal made of paper clips and an old yogurt lid?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I have 59 voicemails.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mmm. Hey, can you ignore those and do something for me instead?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, today. 5 o'clock. Closing Ceremonies.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Notify the athletes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. Jim. Slim Jim. What's going... What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nothing. I just wanted to congratulate you on your condo.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. Thanks. Thanks. It's very cool. It's a three bedroom, gay-friendly.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, would you mind coming out here for a second? I just have something for you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What's this?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: These are the Closing Ceremonies. Step up. You're on the top one. [Michael stands on podium] Congratulations to Michael, because he closed on his condo. So, gold medal. [everyone claps]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't really know what to say. Um, I'm not one for making speeches, but ah, my heart is very full at this moment.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And for Dwight Schrute, the silver medal.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Get up here, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Silver medal.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yep, not as good as gold. [national anthem plays] Why are you playing the national anthem?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um... 'Cause your condo's in America.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. [doves move across cord] What the hell is that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Those are the doves.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey. Morning.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, Pam? Can I see you in here for a second? It's important, so...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. What? What is this?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I found Dwight's wallet in the parking lot.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, my God. What are we gonna do?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know. I don't know. I don't know what the best play is. Do we tear everything up, or do we buy a horse on the Internet? I mean, I don't know what to do. What do you think?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know. I know what to do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, what?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. Put everything back exactly how you found it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Dwight. Jim and I found your wallet in the parking lot.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What did you do to it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm serious. What did you do to it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight, I swear, we didn't do anything.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nice try. [on the phone] Cancel card. Cancel card. Cancel... card.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I mean, you've got, you've got stuff here. You rented "Mermaids." You can't... It's a movie. You can't deduct that, you know that.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's not an office expense.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Next year, you should file your stuff in a basket.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Remember last year he slipped by with "Stripes." He rented "Stripes," he had it for a week.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Please...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: And that got through, so maybe he's thinking he can do that from now on.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Please, please. Please.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What are the specs?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, okay. I'll tell you. Let's see here. Three bedroom, two bath...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [talking over Michael] Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...contemporary townhouse. Two car parking...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [talking over Michael] Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...wall-to-wall carpets...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [talking over Michael] God, what a steal.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...all fixtures included. Yes, this is... This is looking good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Does it have a deck?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think it does.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Have you seen it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Does it have a deck?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think it has a... Yeah, it has a deck. They call it a porch, but it has a deck.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When a man is laying on his deathbed there are four things that go through his mind. Was I well-loved? Check. Did I express myself? Did I let my light shine through? Check. Will an attractive woman cry at my funeral? Check. Probably more than one. Check. Check, check, check, check. Lastly, did I achieve success and own real estate? And when I close on this condo, I will be able to check that one as well.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What do you call it? Schruteball?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. How about skeet Schruteing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Did you just come up with that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That is good. That's it. That's what it is.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow. [cup tinkles]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, oh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, Somebody went in. That was a team effort, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Home owner. About to join an exclusive club, Dwight. Maybe some day these people out here will know what that feels like. Maybe not. Who knows? Not my problem. [groans]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are we ready?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are we gonna do it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is all mine. All the way down around the corner. It's a shared space, but I can use it whenever I want to,

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, so I called in a favor to my buddy at the police department.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, the volunteer Sheriff station.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Same thing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Um, these are the crime statistics for the surrounding square mile over the past four years.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, anything bad?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Two charges of loitering,

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: one noise complaint, several speeding tickets.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you own a gun?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'd think about it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't need a gun.

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello! How are you? I'm, uh, just about to close on 126 over there and I guess we're going to be neighbors. Very cool, very cool. So, uh, so what's the vibe? What's the vibe of this place?

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: Uh, I don't know. It's pretty quiet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh... That's gonna change. [laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because I loves to party and I'm gonna be partying my butt out at this place.

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: Okay, but there's an 11:00 noise curfew.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hi, I am Dwight Schrute, Mr. Scott's associate.

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: Who is Mr. Scott?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Him. I have got a couple of questions about the neighborhood. Have you had any problems with prostitution, crack dealing, gang violence, etcetera?

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here's a question for you. I have a convertible. Is it safe that park that in my driveway. [Man steps back inside his house and shuts the front door] All right. See you soon. Good guy. Um, cool.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: So it's like volleyball.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Okay, you get a one-second hold on the ball...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: ...and you bounce it off the wall on your side of the tape.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, okay. Oh, do... that's what the tape is for. I didn't know.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah, Michael asked about it once. I just pretended not to hear him. He left.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think I'm going to make myself some microwave popcorn. [humming] Press "Popcorn." Oh, that's gonna be delicious. I just love having popcorn in the middle of the afternoon. You know what? I could do with some hot chocolate as well. Oh, drat. I can't make hot chocolate and popcorn at the same time, unless, I can. Boom! Second microwave for le hot chocolat.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, Carol. Hello, how are you?

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Hello, hi. Hey, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good to see you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, boy. This whole condo's shifting. It's like this place was built on ancient Indian burial ground.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Phyllis, Do you have any games that you play in the office?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What do you mean?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um, like stapler tennis or something like that.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Second bedroom for the ladies. I mean, the extra ladies who aren't in my bed, or for friends or family, whoever wants to pop on by to casa de Scott. And right in here... What, what's in here? Uh-oh, bedroom number three. What are we gonna do in there? Limitless possibilities.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Seal it off.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What? [toilet flushing] What are you doing in there?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Fill it full of cotton or soundproof insulation.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, my God. Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Seal it off with drywall so you don't hear Yo-Yo Ma over there all the time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what I might do, I might make this into a kids' room.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Kids? You don't even have a girlfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will have a girlfriend once she sees this place. I'm gonna get married and I'm gonna have kids.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, that depends on how old she is. What if your girlfriend is 55?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not gonna date a 55-year-old woman.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just a possibility.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, it's not. Just shut up.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If you fall in love with her.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're an ass. Shut it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I smell mold.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, you don't.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Living on a farm, your sense of smell gets very sharp. For example, there are beets in the condo two doors down that way. And someone over there, I believe, is a big fan of olives.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm gonna back out of the deal. Nothing personal, but I feel like I have been taken advantage of here.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: How?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This smells of fraud to me. This whole thing just kind of stinks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [looking into his coffee mug] What the hell?
